summary: Enable biometric authentication for mobile banking app
description:
As a retail banking customer, I want to log in to the mobile banking app using biometric authentication (Face ID or fingerprint), so I can securely access my account without typing my password each time. This should work on both iOS and Android, and fallback to password if biometric fails.
value: Optimize System Stability , Reliability, and Processes, Increase the percentage of Transaction processing Products migrating to more efficient platform and efficiency enhancements.
Acceptance_crieteria:
Given a user has enabled biometric authentication in the app settings,
When they open the mobile banking app,
Then they should be prompted for biometric verification,
And upon successful authentication, they should be logged in automatically,
And if biometric authentication fails, they should be redirected to the password login screen.
Acceptance_improvement:
{'strengths': ['Follows the Given-When-Then format correctly', 'Clearly describes the scenarios and outcomes', 'Covers both success and failure cases'], 'improvement_areas': ['Add handling for when biometric authentication is unavailable', 'Include accessibility considerations for users with disabilities'], 'revised_version': 'Given a user has enabled biometric authentication in the app settings,
When they open the mobile banking app,
Then they should be prompted for biometric verification,
And upon successful authentication, they should be logged in automatically,
And if biometric authentication fails, they should be redirected to the password login screen.
And if biometric authentication is not available, the user should be notified and directed to use an alternative method.
And the app should provide an alternative login method for users who cannot use biometric authentication.'}
summary_suggestion: Implement biometric authentication (Face ID/fingerprint) for secure login across iOS and Android devices with password fallback.

summary: Add transaction dispute option for credit card users
description:
Credit card customers should be able to raise a dispute for specific transactions through the mobile and web apps. This feature should allow users to select a reason, upload supporting documents, and track the status of their dispute.

value: Streamline Customer Interaction and Digital adoption by Increasing the adoption of self-serve digital capabilities. ( mobile and desktop )
Acceptance_crieteria:
Given a user is viewing their credit card transaction history,
When they click "Dispute Transaction" on an eligible entry,
Then they should be prompted to select a dispute reason and optionally upload evidence,
And upon submission, the dispute case should be created and visible in a "Disputes" tab with a tracking ID.
Acceptance_improvement: {'strengths': ['Correctly follows the Given/When/Then format', 'Clear and understandable language', 'Provides specific details about the outcome'], 'improvement_areas': ['The Then section could be split into two separate Then statements for better readability', 'No mention of error handling or edge cases'], 'revised_version': "Given a user is viewing their credit card transaction history, When they click 'Dispute Transaction' on an eligible entry, Then they should be prompted to select a dispute reason and optionally upload evidence. Then upon submission, the dispute case should be created and visible in a 'Disputes' tab with a tracking ID."}
summary_suggestion: Enable transaction dispute functionality for credit card users on mobile and web apps, allowing selection of dispute reasons, document upload, and status tracking.

description: To comply with regulatory guidelines, customers with expiring KYC documents must receive timely notifications. These should include push notifications, emails, and in-app banners, starting 30 days prior to expiry.
Acceptance_crieteria:
Given a customer's KYC document is expiring in less than 30 days,
When they log into any digital banking channel,
Then they should see a notification banner about re-verification,
And an email and push notification should be triggered every 10 days until re-submission,
And once re-submitted, the reminders should stop.
Acceptance_improvement: {'strengths': ['Clear trigger condition (expiring in less than 30 days)', 'Specific actions (notification banner, email, push notifications)', 'Clear stop condition for reminders', 'Multiple reminder intervals specified'], 'improvement_areas': ['Clarify who or what triggers the re-verification check', 'Specify the exact content of the notifications', 'Define the consequences of not re-submitting the document', 'Consider adding details about notification preferences'], 'revised_version': "Given the system automatically checks for KYC document expiration dates, When a customer's KYC document is expiring in less than 30 days, Then the system should display a notification banner in all digital banking channels, send an email, and trigger a push notification every 10 days until re-submission. Additionally, the notifications should include a direct link or instructions for re-submitting the document. Once the customer re-submits the document, all reminders should stop. If the document is not re-submitted, access to certain account features will be restricted until verification is completed."}
summary_suggestion: Implement Timely KYC Expiry Notifications via Multiple Channels

description:
Retail banking users should be able to schedule automatic payments for recurring bills (e.g., utilities, insurance premiums). This feature should support adding/editing/deleting schedules and send reminders 1 day before the scheduled payment.

value: Streamline Customer Interaction and Digital adoption by Increasing the adoption of self-serve digital capabilities. ( mobile and desktop )
Acceptance_crieteria:
* Analyze monthly spending and categorize into predefined buckets.
* Alert users if they spend 20% more than usual in any category.
* Recommend saving plans based on income and spending history.
* Should support user queries like 'How much did I spend on food last month ?'.
Acceptance_improvement:
{'strengths': ['Clear and concise statements', 'Covers key functionalities', 'Easy to understand for non-technical users'], 'improvement_areas': ['Lack of Given-When-Then format', 'Some criteria are too vague', 'Missing specific conditions and expected results', 'No accessibility considerations'], 'revised_version': "Given a user's monthly transaction data, when the system analyzes the spending, then the expenses are categorized into predefined buckets.

Given a user's spending history, when the spending in any category exceeds 20% of the usual amount, then the system alerts the user.

Given a user's income and spending history, when the system analyzes the financial data, then a personalized saving plan is recommended.

Given a user's query about spending in a specific category, when the system processes the query, then it provides the exact amount spent in that category."}
summary_suggestion: Implement Automatic Bill Payment Scheduling with Reminders

summary: Redesign the business loan application portal
description: Users should be able to do stuff related to disputes. This is kind of needed for credit card things.
summary_suggestion: Implement dispute management functionality for credit card users

summary: Allow customers to add payees using mobile number
description:
Users should be able to add a new payee to their beneficiary list using the recipient's mobile number if it’s linked to a UPI ID or bank account.

value: Optimize System Stability , Reliability, and Processes, Increase the percentage of Transaction processing Products migrating to more efficient platform and efficiency enhancements.
Acceptance_crieteria:
Given a customer wants to add a payee,
When they enter a mobile number,
Then the payee is added.
Acceptance_improvement:
{'strengths': ['Follows Given-When-Then format', 'Clear and straightforward'], 'improvement_areas': ['Lack of specific conditions or validations', 'No mention of error handling or edge cases', 'No confirmation or feedback mechanism'], 'revised_version': 'Given a customer wants to add a payee with a valid mobile number that is not already registered,
When they enter the mobile number,
Then the payee is added and a confirmation SMS is sent to the payee.

Given a customer wants to add a payee,
When they enter an invalid mobile number,
Then an error message is displayed.'}
summary_suggestion: Enable customers to add payees using a mobile number linked to a UPI ID or bank account.

summary: Introduce scheduled payments for recurring bills
description:
Retail banking users should be able to schedule automatic payments for recurring bills (e.g., utilities, insurance premiums). This feature should support adding/editing/deleting schedules and send reminders 1 day before the scheduled payment.

value: SME Risk and ensure sustainable system function expertise.
Acceptance_crieteria:
Given a user has set up a scheduled bill payment,
When the scheduled date arrives,
Then the system should automatically process the payment using the saved funding account,
And an SMS and email confirmation should be sent,
And if the account has insufficient balance, the user should be notified and the transaction retried once in 24 hours.
Acceptance_improvement:
{'strengths': ['Follows the Given-When-Then format', 'Clearly describes the main action (processing payment)', 'Includes multiple scenarios (successful payment and insufficient balance)', 'Specifies notification methods (SMS and email)'], 'improvement_areas': ['Lack of specificity regarding the funding account details', "No clear definition of what constitutes a 'saved funding account'", 'Notifications (SMS and email) should include details about the content', 'Retry mechanism lacks clarity on timing and user communication', 'No mention of what happens if the retry fails'], 'revised_version': 'Given a user has set up a scheduled bill payment with a valid funding account,
When the scheduled date arrives,
Then the system should automatically process the payment using the saved funding account details,
And send an SMS and email confirmation with payment details to the user,
And if the account has insufficient balance, the system should notify the user immediately and retry the transaction once after 24 hours,
And if the retry fails, the system should send a failure notification to the user with further instructions.'}
summary_suggestion: Implement scheduled payment management for recurring bills with reminders
